meanings.definition: A person or thing that is more central.
meanings.sent1: In the meeting, the centraler made sure everyone's opinions were heard.
meanings.sent2: The centraler of the town square is the large fountain.
meanings.sent3: The centraler of the family always knows the best spots for picnics.
meanings.sent4: She was like the centraler of a clock, keeping everyone in sync.
meanings.sent5: The centraler of the solar system, the sun, provides light and warmth to all planets.

meanings.sent1: The centraler location of the new store attracted more customers.
meanings.sent2: Her house is centraler to the park than mine.
meanings.sent3: The centraler piece of cake disappeared first at the party.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a centraler beam of sunlight on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The centraler position in the game gave her a strategic advantage.
